title: Millwall start life without Neil Harris with a win after Leeds' Gaetano Berardi is sent off
text:
Millwall 2 Leeds United 1

Climbing the steps up to the press box here, it is impossible to walk more than a few feet without seeing a photograph featuring Neil Harris – either as player or manager – such is his attachment to all of the club’s key moments in recent years.​

The Den will have to get used to life without the man who led the line for a decade and then managed the club for four and a half seasons before leaving this week after a run of seven games without a victory. Caretaker manager Adam Barrett said: “Neil phoned me while I was watching my boy play football for his school. He told me he was resigning and that he wanted me to take the game. It hit me like a ton of bricks. He came in on Friday and spoke to the staff and the players. I’ll always be in contact with him and be forever grateful to him.”​

The new era began well against Leeds, who played with 10 men for more than 70 minutes. “To stand here and get a win for him means an awful lot. It was an emotionally draining 48 hours and as you can see, the atmosphere was electric.”​
